alert.note: Alert for Eureka (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 05 at 9:28PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM PDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Nevada, including the following county, Eureka. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 928 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.1 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portions of State Route 278 between Garden Pass and Pine Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
